issue.title: Refactor: Replace acronyms in exported function names for clarity

labels.name: priority:high
labels.description: High priority issue that needs immediate attention

issue.body:
Several exported functions use acronyms (e.g., fliwc, fliwc_transcript_files) that are not self-explanatory. This issue tracks the refactoring of these function names to be more descriptive, following the audit plan for naming conventions and API consistency.

Affected Functions:
- fliwc() -> summarize_transcript_metrics()
- fliwc_transcript_files() -> summarize_transcript_files()

Tasks:
- Rename functions in codebase
- Update all references in code, tests, and documentation
- Update roxygen2 documentation and examples
- Update NEWS.md for breaking changes
- Ensure all tests pass

Rationale: Clear, descriptive function names improve usability, maintainability, and CRAN readiness. Acronyms should be avoided unless widely recognized. See AUDIT_LOG.md for details and rationale.

issue.title: Remove or deprecate demo/legacy functions (hello, load_and_process_zoom_transcript)
issue.body: Remove hello from exports (not part of the package API). Remove or fully deprecate load_and_process_zoom_transcript (ensure it is not in NAMESPACE and is clearly marked as deprecated in documentation). Update NEWS.md to document these changes.

issue.title: Refactor verbose or unclear function names (e.g., make_students_only_transcripts_summary_df)
issue.body: Rename make_students_only_transcripts_summary_df to a more concise, descriptive name (e.g., summarize_enrolled_students()). Review all make_ functions and consider if create_, summarize_, filter_, or join_ would be clearer. Ensure all function names follow tidyverse conventions (verbs, clarity, no unnecessary acronyms).

issue.title: Standardize function prefixes for consistency
issue.body: Standardize function prefixes for consistency: Use create_ or make_ for new objects, summarize_ for aggregations, filter_ for subsetting, join_ for merges, load_ for data loading, write_ for data writing, plot_ for plotting, process_ for transformations.

issue.title: Standardize argument names and order
issue.body: Standardize argument names and order: Use data or df as the first argument for all functions that operate on a data frame/tibble. Use descriptive names for multiple data frames (e.g., roster_df, session_df). Avoid abbreviations unless standard (e.g., df). Ensure data argument is first, followed by parameters, then optional arguments with defaults.

issue.title: Update and complete roxygen2 documentation for all exported functions
issue.body: Ensure all exported functions have comprehensive roxygen2 documentation: Description, Arguments (with types and defaults), Return value, Examples (including edge cases), @export tag. Use the @deprecated tag for any functions being phased out.

issue.title: Internalize helper/utility functions not intended for export
issue.body: Make any function not intended for end users internal (not exported). Prefix with a dot (e.g., .helper_function) if desired.

issue.title: Ensure all tabular outputs are tibbles and document return types
issue.body: All functions that return tabular data should return a tibble. Document the structure of the returned object in the roxygen2 docs.

issue.title: Update NEWS.md, tests, README, and vignettes for all API changes
issue.body: Document all breaking changes, renames, and deprecations in NEWS.md. Update or add tests to match new function names, arguments, and behaviors. Update all usage examples in README and vignettes to match the new API.

issue.title: Cross-reference issues and track progress in AUDIT_LOG.md
issue.body: As each issue is created, add its number/link to the relevant checklist item in AUDIT_LOG.md. As each subtask is completed, update the log with dates, decisions, and outcomes.

issue.title: Optimize GitHub Actions workflow for faster dependency installation
issue.body:
## Current Issue
The R-CMD-check workflow is taking too long to install dependencies (7+ minutes), which slows down the development process.

## Proposed Solution
Implement optimizations to the GitHub Actions workflow as outlined in PROJECT.md:

### 1. Package Caching
- [ ] Implement R package caching using `actions/cache`
- [ ] Cache both CRAN and GitHub packages
- [ ] Set appropriate cache keys and paths

### 2. Dependency Management
- [ ] Replace manual dependency installation with `r-lib/actions/setup-r-dependencies@v2`
- [ ] Configure to install only necessary dependencies
- [ ] Use `dependencies: c("Depends", "Imports", "LinkingTo")` instead of `TRUE`

### 3. System Dependencies
- [ ] Cache system package installations
- [ ] Optimize apt-get update/install commands
- [ ] Consider using pre-built Docker images

### 4. Workflow Structure
- [ ] Separate dependency installation from testing
- [ ] Use matrix builds for different R versions
- [ ] Implement conditional steps based on changes

### 5. Monitoring
- [ ] Add timing information to workflow steps
- [ ] Track cache hit rates
- [ ] Monitor workflow performance metrics

## Implementation Steps
1. Create new branch for workflow optimization
2. Update R-CMD-check.yaml with optimized configuration
3. Test workflow performance
4. Document optimization results
5. Create pull request with changes

## Expected Benefits
- Reduced workflow execution time
- More reliable dependency installation
- Better resource utilization
- Improved developer experience

## References
- [r-lib/actions documentation](https://github.com/r-lib/actions)
- [GitHub Actions caching](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-workflows/caching-dependencies-to-speed-up-workflows)
- [R package development workflow](https://r-pkgs.org/whole-game.html)

issue.title: Create verification helper script
issue.body:
## Overview
Create a helper script to automate all verification commands and streamline pre-CRAN validation.

## Requirements

### Script Functionality
- Automate all verification commands from PROJECT.md
- Include both development and pre-CRAN submission checks
- Provide clear output and error reporting
- Allow selective running of specific check phases

### Script Structure
https://github.com/revgizmo/zoomstudentengagement_cursor/issues/46

### Check Phases
1. **Development Phase** (Quick checks)
   - devtools::load_all()
   - devtools::test()
   - devtools::check_man()
   - devtools::spell_check()

2. **Pre-CRAN Phase** (Comprehensive checks)
   - styler::style_pkg()
   - lintr::lint_package()
   - devtools::document()
   - devtools::build_readme()
   - devtools::test()
   - covr::package_coverage()
   - devtools::check()
   - devtools::build()

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Script runs all verification commands successfully
- [ ] Clear output formatting and error reporting
- [ ] Configurable to run specific check phases
- [ ] Documented usage and examples
- [ ] Integrated into development workflow

## Priority
LOW - Nice to have for development efficiency

## Benefits
- Reduce human error in pre-submission validation
- Standardize verification process across contributors
- Speed up development workflow
- Ensure consistent quality checks

issue.title: Generalize Topic parsing in load_zoom_recorded_sessions_list to only extract section and optionally dept
issue.body:
The current implementation of load_zoom_recorded_sessions_list parses the Topic field to extract dept, section, day, time, and instructor. However, only section (and optionally dept for filtering) are required downstream.

This issue proposes to generalize the Topic parsing to robustly extract only section (and optionally dept), making the function resilient to changes in the Topic format. The regex should match the dept and section at the start of the Topic string, regardless of what follows.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Only section (and optionally dept) are extracted from Topic.
- The function works for both old and new Topic formats (e.g., 'LTF 101 - Mon 10:00 (Dr. Smith)' and 'DATASCI 201.006: RDADA Live Session').
- If section cannot be extracted, set it to NA and optionally warn the user.
- Update documentation to reflect the new behavior.

issue.body:
## Summary
The test suite currently has issues that need to be addressed. This includes both general test suite restoration and specific test warnings that should be cleaned up.

## Current Test Warnings
The tests for  currently produce warnings about conditions with length > 1. These warnings occur in multiple test files:
- test-make_clean_names_df.R
- test-name-matching.R
- test-plotting_functions.R

### Current Behavior
When running tests, we see warnings like:


This occurs because  in  can return vectors of length > 1, and the test assertions are not explicitly handling this case.

### Expected Behavior
Tests should run without warnings, properly handling vector lengths in all assertions.

## Proposed Solution
1. Review all test assertions in affected files
2. Update assertions to explicitly handle vector lengths where needed
3. Consider using  or similar to handle vectorized operations
4. Add explicit length checks in assertions
5. Update test documentation to clarify expected behavior

## Files to Modify
- tests/testthat/test-make_clean_names_df.R
- tests/testthat/test-name-matching.R
- tests/testthat/test-plotting_functions.R
- R/make_clean_names_df.R (if needed for implementation changes)

## General Test Suite Tasks
- [ ] Review and update test data creation functions to match current code requirements
- [ ] Update test files to use correct argument names and order
- [ ] Fix any code or documentation issues that prevent tests from passing
- [ ] Ensure all tests pass locally

## Priority
Medium - The warnings don't affect functionality but should be cleaned up for better test hygiene and maintainability.

## Related Issues

- Related to function naming and API consistency (#16)

issue.title: Fix global variable binding warnings in R CMD check

labels.name: priority:high
labels.description: High priority issue that needs immediate attention

issue.body:
## Summary

R CMD check is reporting multiple 'no visible binding for global variable' warnings that need to be addressed.

## Current Issues

### Global Variable Warnings (15 total)
Functions with undefined global variables:
- create_session_mapping: ID, Topic, Start Time, start_time, session_date, zoom_recording_id, topic, session_time, notes
- load_session_mapping: zoom_recording_id, topic, notes, dept.x, instructor.x, session_date
- summarize_transcript_files: transcript_file_match

### Root Cause
Functions are referencing variables that are not properly defined in their scope, likely due to recent refactoring or incomplete updates.

## Specific Problems

### 1. Undefined Variables
- Column names referenced but not defined
- Variables used in dplyr operations without proper scoping
- Missing variable declarations

### 2. Affected Functions
- create_session_mapping() - 9 undefined variables
- load_session_mapping() - 6 undefined variables  
- summarize_transcript_files() - 1 undefined variable

### 3. Impact
- R CMD check warnings
- Potential runtime errors
- Poor code quality

## Proposed Solution

1. Audit all functions for undefined global variables
2. Properly scope variables within functions
3. Update function signatures as needed
4. Add proper variable declarations
5. Test functions after changes

## Acceptance Criteria

- No 'no visible binding for global variable' warnings
- All functions properly scope their variables
- No regression in functionality
- R CMD check passes with 0 warnings

## Priority
HIGH - This affects CRAN compliance

## Related Issues
- Related to CRAN compliance (#21)
- Part of code quality improvements
- Blocks clean R CMD check

issue.title: Fix: Restore passing test suite and clean up test warnings

milestone.title: Test Suite Cleanup
milestone.description: Target: January 2025 - Fix test warnings and ensure all tests pass

issue.body:
## Summary
The test suite currently has issues that need to be addressed. This includes both general test suite restoration and specific test warnings that should be cleaned up.

## Current Test Warnings
The tests for  currently produce warnings about conditions with length > 1. These warnings occur in multiple test files:
- test-make_clean_names_df.R
- test-name-matching.R
- test-plotting_functions.R

### Current Behavior
When running tests, we see warnings like:


This occurs because  in  can return vectors of length > 1, and the test assertions are not explicitly handling this case.

### Expected Behavior
Tests should run without warnings, properly handling vector lengths in all assertions.

## Proposed Solution
1. Review all test assertions in affected files
2. Update assertions to explicitly handle vector lengths where needed
3. Consider using  or similar to handle vectorized operations
4. Add explicit length checks in assertions
5. Update test documentation to clarify expected behavior

## Files to Modify
- tests/testthat/test-make_clean_names_df.R
- tests/testthat/test-name-matching.R
- tests/testthat/test-plotting_functions.R
- R/make_clean_names_df.R (if needed for implementation changes)

## General Test Suite Tasks
- [ ] Review and update test data creation functions to match current code requirements
- [ ] Update test files to use correct argument names and order
- [ ] Fix any code or documentation issues that prevent tests from passing
- [ ] Ensure all tests pass locally

## Priority
Medium - The warnings don't affect functionality but should be cleaned up for better test hygiene and maintainability.

## Related Issues
- Part of the larger test suite cleanup (#15)
- Related to function naming and API consistency (#16)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All tests pass without warnings
- [ ] Test assertions properly handle vector lengths
- [ ] Documentation is updated to reflect changes
- [ ] No regression in existing functionality

## Rationale
A green test suite is essential for safe refactoring and future development. This will provide a solid foundation for the ongoing codebase audit and API improvements.

issue.title: fix: Address lintr warnings and fix department code typo
issue.body:
## Summary

This PR addresses code quality issues and fixes a typo:

### Changes Made:
- **Fix seq_linter warnings**: Use seq_len\(\) and seq_along\(\) instead of 1:nrow\(\) and 1:length\(\)
- **Fix vector_logic_linter warning**: Use && instead of & in conditional expressions  
- **Fix department code typo**: Change LFT to LTF \(correct department code\)

### Quality Assurance:
- ✅ All 453 tests passing
- ✅ All R CMD check errors resolved \(0 errors, 6 notes\)
- ✅ Code quality improved with better linting compliance

### Files Modified:
- R/create_session_mapping.R - Fixed seq_linter warnings
- R/detect_duplicate_transcripts.R - Fixed seq_linter warnings
- R/load_cancelled_classes.R - Fixed vector_logic_linter warning
- R/create_analysis_config.R - Fixed department code typo
- tests/testthat/test-create_analysis_config.R - Updated test expectations

This improves code quality and fixes a regression introduced in previous work.

issue.title: Fix column naming regression from recent cleanup

labels.name: priority:high
labels.description: High priority issue that needs immediate attention

issue.body:
## Summary

Recent column naming cleanup (Issues #52, #54) introduced inconsistencies that are causing test failures.

## Current Issues

### Test Failures (8 total)
- make_clean_names_df tests failing due to transcript_section vs section column conflicts
- join_transcripts_list tests failing due to missing course_section column
- make_blank_section_names_lookup_csv tests failing due to column structure mismatches

### Root Cause
The column naming cleanup changed some column names but did not update all related functions and tests consistently.

## Specific Problems

### 1. Column Name Inconsistencies
- transcript_section vs section naming conflicts
- course_section column missing in some contexts
- Empty vector assignment errors in dplyr operations

### 2. Affected Functions
- make_clean_names_df() - Multiple test failures
- join_transcripts_list() - Column missing errors
- make_blank_section_names_lookup_csv() - Structure mismatches

### 3. Test Files Affected
- tests/testthat/test-make_clean_names_df.R
- tests/testthat/test-join_transcripts_list.R
- tests/testthat/test-make_blank_section_names_lookup_csv.R
- tests/testthat/test-name-matching.R

## Proposed Solution

1. Audit all column names across the package
2. Standardize naming conventions consistently
3. Update all affected functions to use consistent column names
4. Fix all test data to match new column structure
5. Update documentation to reflect changes

## Acceptance Criteria

- All column names are consistent across the package
- All tests pass without failures
- No dplyr vector size errors
- Documentation reflects current column structure
- No regression in existing functionality

## Priority
HIGH - This blocks CRAN submission and affects core functionality

## Related Issues
- Related to Issues #52, #54 (column naming cleanup)
- Blocks CRAN submission
- Part of test suite restoration (#24)

issue.title: Fix: Restore passing test suite and clean up test warnings

milestone.title: Test Suite Cleanup
milestone.description: Target: January 2025 - Fix test warnings and ensure all tests pass

issue.body:
## Summary
The test suite currently has issues that need to be addressed. This includes both general test suite restoration and specific test warnings that should be cleaned up.

## Current Test Warnings
The tests for  currently produce warnings about conditions with length > 1. These warnings occur in multiple test files:
- test-make_clean_names_df.R
- test-name-matching.R
- test-plotting_functions.R

### Current Behavior
When running tests, we see warnings like:


This occurs because  in  can return vectors of length > 1, and the test assertions are not explicitly handling this case.

### Expected Behavior
Tests should run without warnings, properly handling vector lengths in all assertions.

## Proposed Solution
1. Review all test assertions in affected files
2. Update assertions to explicitly handle vector lengths where needed
3. Consider using  or similar to handle vectorized operations
4. Add explicit length checks in assertions
5. Update test documentation to clarify expected behavior

## Files to Modify
- tests/testthat/test-make_clean_names_df.R
- tests/testthat/test-name-matching.R
- tests/testthat/test-plotting_functions.R
- R/make_clean_names_df.R (if needed for implementation changes)

## General Test Suite Tasks
- [ ] Review and update test data creation functions to match current code requirements
- [ ] Update test files to use correct argument names and order
- [ ] Fix any code or documentation issues that prevent tests from passing
- [ ] Ensure all tests pass locally

## Priority
Medium - The warnings don't affect functionality but should be cleaned up for better test hygiene and maintainability.

## Related Issues
- Part of the larger test suite cleanup (#15)
- Related to function naming and API consistency (#16)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All tests pass without warnings
- [ ] Test assertions properly handle vector lengths
- [ ] Documentation is updated to reflect changes
- [ ] No regression in existing functionality

## Rationale
A green test suite is essential for safe refactoring and future development. This will provide a solid foundation for the ongoing codebase audit and API improvements.

issue.title: Add transcript_file column with intelligent duplicate handling

labels.name: priority:high
labels.description: High priority issue that needs immediate attention

issue.body:
## Feature Request: Add transcript_file column with intelligent duplicate handling

### Problem Statement
The package needs to handle both single transcript file processing and multi-file consolidation while intelligently detecting and handling duplicate transcripts.

### Current State
- load_zoom_transcript() and process_zoom_transcript() already have transcript_file column (unstaged changes)
- Basic duplicate handling exists in load_zoom_recorded_sessions_list() (file-level)
- No content-level duplicate detection for transcripts

### Proposed Solution

#### 1. Complete transcript_file Column Implementation
- Update consolidate_transcript() to preserve transcript_file column
- Update add_dead_air_rows() to preserve transcript_file column  
- Update summarize_transcript_metrics() to include transcript_file column
- Update summarize_transcript_files() to handle transcript_file column properly

#### 2. Enhanced Duplicate Detection System

##### Tier 1: File-level Deduplication (Existing)
- Based on file metadata (name, size, timestamp)
- Handled in load_zoom_recorded_sessions_list()

##### Tier 2: Content-level Deduplication (New)
- New function: detect_duplicate_transcripts(transcript_list, similarity_threshold = 0.95)
- New parameter: deduplicate_content = TRUE/FALSE in summarize_transcript_files()
- Content similarity based on speaker patterns, comment timing, word count, duration

#### 3. Usage Patterns

##### Single File Processing
- Process single file - transcript_file column tracks source
- result <- process_zoom_transcript('path/to/transcript.vtt')
- result contains 'transcript.vtt'

##### Multi-File Processing with Deduplication
- Process multiple files with duplicate detection
- result <- summarize_transcript_files(transcript_file_names = transcript_list, deduplicate_content = TRUE)
- Duplicate transcripts are identified and handled appropriately

#### 4. Benefits
1. Traceability: Always know which transcript file each row came from
2. Deduplication: Intelligent handling of duplicate content
3. Flexibility: Support both single-file and multi-file workflows
4. Data Integrity: Prevent double-counting of duplicate transcripts
5. Debugging: Easier to identify and resolve data issues

### Priority
HIGH - This is a foundational improvement that addresses data integrity and traceability concerns.
